                If you're looking for information on the next Blox Fruits update, you have come to the right place. One of Roblox’s most popular and most entertaining games, Blox Fruits is a seafaring adventure that pulls inspiration from the iconic anime franchise One Piece.Since launching in 2019, this swashbuckling experience has remained at the top of the charts and received a steady stream of updates to refine and improve the title. With such a large and fervent playerbase, there’s little surprise that the demand for updates is huge.So, for those of you out there who have already scoured the many seas and are looking for more content to find and loot to plunder, we’re detailing all the information available on the next Blox Fruits update. You can find all the details below:When is the next Blox Fruits update coming?There is currently no official release date for Blox Fruits Update 29. However, given the previous cadence of releases and fan speculation, many are assuming it will drop in either late January or early February of 2026.When was the last Blox Fruits update?The last major update for Blox Fruits was Update 28, otherwise known as The Tiger Update. This update added the Tiger fruit (formerly the Leopard), introduced the Werewolf Blox Fruit mutation, and the Trick or Treating event.Blox Fruits update patch notesBelow are all of the patch notes for Blox Fruit Update 28: The Tiger UpdateIncreased Max Level Capacity: 2750-2800Reworked Blox Fruit:Tiger (formerly Leopard)New Blox Fruit mutation:WerewolfNew EventTrick Or TreatingThe First, Second annd Third Seas are decorated for Halloween.Mygame43's bunker has been added to the Cafe.New Accessories:Pumpkin MaskCoven Witch HatNew NPCSWitchHalloween Gacha DealerNew BossRip_ReturnNew Boss RaidUnbound WerewolfNew potionsDisguise ElixirSuspicious Growth PotionBig Head ElixirPumpkin PotionLava Bomb ElixirMonster Mash ElixirCandy ConcoctionNew CurrencyCandy CornNew FishJack-O-FishJester ClownfishZombie BassVampire SquidTerrorbonesNew Sunken ChestsFall ChestHalloween ChestNew Player Profile BackgroundsFull MoonHalloween TapestryChangesThe Titles Specialist interface has been redesigned.Tiger + WerewolfM1: Transformed and awakened hits now break Observation.Z: The final projectile breaks the Observation, has a larger area of effect and hitbox. The awakened final blow has a longer range.X: Now breaks Observation (both on the ground and in the air).C: Improved Hitboxes for Grabbing and Punching.F: While awake, the user no longer takes damage when using the move against enemies.Improved Werewolf: Defeating an enemy while awake will now fully restore the user's health

body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                If you are an ardent Blox Fruits player, the ocean-faring Roblox experience that has taken the world by storm, then you will want to keep a keen eye on the many stock options scattered around the Blox Fruits seas. Those titular fruits are the keys to success, but not only are some rarer than others, but vendors constantly change their wares, so we’re here to explain everything you need to know about the Blox Fruits stock as well as restock times.What is the Blox Fruits Stock System?The most important part of Blox Fruit is, unsurprisingly, those titular Blox Fruits. If you want to expand your collection, you will need to amass some money through regular gameplay and then head to a vendor to buy Blox Fruit.Sadly, not all of the Blox Fruit are available at once, and their appearance is dictated by their rarity. So, you’re much more likely to see common Blox Fruit than you are rare ones. Anyone wanting to expand their abilities or collect all of the Blox Fruit will need to routinely visit the in-game vendors with the hopes of eventually finding and purchasing every Blox Fruit in the game. Regular vendors have at least three Blox Fruit, while the Advanced Fruit Dealer on Mirage Island holds five.How often do Blox Fruits stocks refresh?The regular Blox Fruit stocks offered by Normal dealers change every four hours. Meanwhile, the Advanced dealers change their stock every two hours instead.When do Blox Fruits stocks refresh?The Blox Fruits vendors' stock refreshes at a set time depending on your region. So, every four hours, or at one of the times listed below:Timezone1st Restock2nd Restock3rd Restock4th Restock5th Restock6th RestockPacific Time12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PMMountain Time1 AM5 AM9 AM1 PM5 PM9 PMCentral Time2 AM6 AM10 AM2 PM6 PM10 PMEastern Time3 AM7 AM11 AM3 PM7 PM11 PMAtlantic Time12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PMBST (UK TIME)12 AM4 AM8 AM12 PM4 PM8 PMHow do I know what Blox Fruits will be stocked?There is no way to find out ahead of time which Blox Fruits will be stocked by the Normal Dealer or the Advanced Dealer. However, you can use third-party websites and apps to see exactly which Blox Fruits are in stock at the current moment in time. How to check Blox Fruit stock in-gameIf you want to check the Roblox Blox Fruit stock, you will have to find and interact with any of the many dealers within the game. If you are looking for a particular fruit, or just want to make checking stock easier, you can save next to a dealer and then respawn next to them, to save yourself a journey.

                                                                                                                                                               PlayStation's Black Friday 2025 sales have kicked off, and if you're looking to grow your PS5 library, then you'll want to check out this deal on Stellar Blade. Shift Up's action-RPG is on sale for $40, a big cut from its usual price of $70. The discount is available at Amazon, PlayStation Direct, Walmart, and Best Buy.                                 Stellar Blade                                                                $40 (was $70)                                                                                                                                                                                    The Stellar Blade standard edition includes the full base game.Set in a future where humanity has been driven from Earth by the emergence of the Naytibas--hyper-aggressive monsters that can evolve into powerful forms and infect technology--Stellar Blade puts you in control of Eve, the last survivor of the 7th Airborne Squad, which was decimated before their operation could properly begin. Eve sets out to destroy the Elder Naytibas and reclaim Earth, while also carving a path forward through the Alpha Naytibas and their minions.Stellar Blade features many elements that are similar to the Souls-like genre--from challenging boss fights to campsites that respawn monsters when you rest at them--but it also merges those mechanics with more traditional action game ideas, allowing you to increase Eve's power and skillset steadily along the way. Since launch, Stellar Blade has received numerous updates. Eve's wardrobe has been expanded with several new outfits, and paid DLC expansions have seen the crossovers with Nier: Automata and Goddess of Victory: Nikke.
